intro: Biscutella didyma var. confusa, commonly known as the narrowleaf biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a taproot system that allows it to store water and nutrients efficiently. The flowers are arranged in racemes and bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees.
